intro: Centropogon occultus var. phaeus, commonly known as the dark centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive dark-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture. The flowers, which are usually purple or dark red, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators.
